sen.j: 奥村 吉兵衛（おくむら きちべえ）は千家十職の1人。
sen.e: Kichibe OKUMURA is one of the Senke Jisshoku (The Sen Family's Ten Craftsmen).
Kichibe OKUMURA was one of the Senke Jisshoku (The Sen Family's Ten Craftsmen).
Kichibe OKUMURA was one of the Senke Jisshoku (The Ten Craftsmen of the House of Sen).
sen.cmt: The Sen Family's Ten Craftsmen→The Ten Craftsmen of the House of Senとしました。

sen.j: 三千家御用達の表具師として、家元らの揮毫の軸装（掛け軸に仕立てること）や屏風、釜の敷物の一種である「釜敷」の製作などを行う。
sen.e: The family has been working as scroll mounters for the three Houses of Sen, mounting pieces of calligraphy written by the school heads on hanging scrolls, creating folding screens and 'kamashiki,' a kind of placemat which is laid under the teakettle.

The family has worked as scroll mounters for the three Houses of Sen, mounting pieces of calligraphy written by the school heads on hanging scrolls, creating folding screens and 'kamashiki,' a kind of placemat which is laid under the teakettle.

sen.j: 当代は12代。
sen.e: The present head is the twelfth generation.
The present head is the twelfth generation headmaster.
The present head is the twelfth generation headmaster.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 奥村家は佐々木氏の末裔を称し、近江国北部の「谷の庄」なるところの郷士であったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the Okumura family was the descendants of the Sasaki clan and country samurai of 'Tani no sho,' the northern Omi Province.
It is said that the Okumura family were the descendants of the Sasaki clan and country samurai of 'Tani no sho,' the northern Omi Province.
It is said that the Okumura family were the descendants of the Sasaki clan and country samurai of 'Tani no sho,' the northern Omi Province.

sen.j: 奥村三郎定道の代、姉川の戦いの後、主家浅井氏が滅亡して浪人となる。
sen.e: After the battle of Anegawa, Saburo Sadamichi OKUMURA's master, the Asai family, collapsed, and he became a ronin (masterless samurai).
After the battle of Anegawa, Saburo Sadamichi OKUMURA's master, the Asai family, collapsed, and he became a ronin (masterless samurai).

sen.cmt: battleの頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 定道の息子・奥村源六郎定次は長男・源子郎を前田利家に仕官させ、長男は後に「奥村摂津守定光」を名乗り加賀藩士となる。
sen.e: Sadamichi's son, Genrokuro Sadatsugu OKUMURA, made his eldest son Genshiro serve Toshiie MAEDA, and later the son became a clansman of Kaga Domain, calling himself 'Okumura Settsu no Kami Sadamitsu.'
Sadamichi's son, Genrokuro Sadatsugu OKUMURA, made his eldest son Genshiro serve Toshiie MAEDA, and later the son became a clansman of Kaga Domain, calling himself 'Okumura Settsu no Kami Sadamitsu.'
Sadamichi's son, Genrokuro Sadatsugu OKUMURA, made his eldest son Genshiro serve Toshiie MAEDA, and later the son became a clansman of Kaga Domain, calling himself 'Okumura Settsu no Kami Sadamitsu.'

sen.j: 次男・吉右衛門清定は仕官せず、母方の家業を継いで商人となり京にて表具屋となる。
sen.e: His second son Kichiemon Kiyosada did not enter government service, and succeeded to the family business of his mother's side, becoming a merchant and a scroll mounter in Kyo.
His second son Kichiemon Kiyosada did not enter government service, and succeeded the family business on his mother's side, becoming a merchant and a scroll mounter in Kyo.
His second son Kichiemon Kiyosada did not enter government service, and succeeded the family business on his mother's side, becoming a merchant and a scroll mounter in Kyo.

sen.j: この清定が初代とされる。
sen.e: The Kiyosada was the first generation.
Kiyosada was the first generation headmaster.
Kiyosada was the first generation headmaster.

sen.j: 2代・吉兵衛は表千家6代・覚々斎の取りなしにより紀州徳川家御用達となり、家運興隆の基礎を作る。
sen.e: The second Kichibe became a purveyor to the Kishu Tokugawa family, being introduced by Kakukakusai, the sixth head of Omote Senke (the main branch of the Senke school of tea ceremony), and laid the foundations of prosperity of the family.

The second Kichibe became a purveyor to the Kishu Tokugawa family, being introduced by Kakukakusai, the sixth head of Omote Senke (the main branch of the Senke school of tea ceremony), and laid the foundations for the prosperity of the family.

The second Kichibe became a purveyor to the Kishu Tokugawa family, being introduced by Kakukakusai, the sixth head of Omote Senke (the main branch of the Senke school of tea ceremony), and laid the foundations for the prosperity of the family.

sen.j: その後数代に渡り男子が夭折し跡取りに恵まれず、代々婿養子を郷里の北近江より迎える事態となる。
sen.e: Over several generations, the men in the family had died young and had to adopt men as the husbands for their daughters from the family's hometown, the northern Omi Province.
Over several generations, the men in the family died young, forcing them to adopt men as husbands for their daughters from the family's hometown, the northern Omi Province.
Over several generations, the men in the family died young, forcing them to adopt men as husbands for their daughters from the family's hometown, the northern Omi Province.

sen.j: その中の1人、6代・吉兵衛は奥村家の功績をまとめるために調査を重ね、家系図はもちろん、歴代の表具作成の記録などを文書化する。
sen.e: The sixth Kichibe, one of the adopted sons-in-law, conducted investigations in order to compile the achievement of the Okumura family, making a record of mounting done by all the past generations as well as a family tree.

The sixth Kichibe, one of the adopted sons-in-law, conducted investigations in order to compile the achievements of the Okumura family, making a record of mounting done by past generations as well as a family tree.

The sixth Kichibe, one of the adopted sons-in-law, conducted investigations in order to compile the achievements of the Okumura family, making a record of mounting done by past generations as well as a family tree.

sen.j: 8代・吉兵衛は歴代の中でも最も名手といわれる一方、国学、儒学に通じ、尊皇攘夷派の学者や志士と深く交わりを持った人物である。
sen.e: While the eighth Kichibe was said to be the most excellent scroll mounter of all the generations, he was also familiar with the National Learning and Confucianism, maintaining deep friendships with scholars and loyal supporters of "Revere the Emperor and expel the foreigners."

While the eighth Kichibe was said to be the best scroll mounter out of all the generations, he was also familiar with Language and Confucianism, maintaining deep friendships with scholars and loyal supporters of "Revere the Emperor and expel the foreigners."

While the eighth Kichibe was said to be the best scroll mounter out of all the generations, he was also familiar with Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature) and Confucianism, maintaining deep friendships with scholars and loyal supporters of "Revere the Emperor and expel the foreigners."

sen.j: しかし、皮肉にも明治維新後の文明開化により茶道が衰退、奥村家は大ダメージを受ける。
sen.e: Ironically, the tea ceremony declined due to the civilization and enlightenment which came after the Meiji Restoration, and the Okumura family was damaged gravely.
Ironically, tea ceremony declined due to civilization and enlightenment which came after the Meiji Restoration, and the Okumura family was badly damaged.
Ironically, tea ceremony declined due to civilization and enlightenment which came after the Meiji Restoration, and the Okumura family was badly damaged.

sen.j: 9代・吉兵衛はこの困難な時代に名跡を継ぎ、奥村家の建て直しに成功、現在に至る。
sen.e: The ninth Kichibe succeeded to the professional name in the period of hard time, but managed to reconstruct the Okumura family, which still continues today.
The ninth Kichibe succeeded the family during a period of hardship, but managed to reconstruct the Okumura family, which continues to this day.
The ninth Kichibe succeeded the family during a period of hardship, but managed to reconstruct the Okumura family, which continues to this day.

sen.j: 三千家合作の三幅対として有名な土佐光孚筆の絵のうち、表千家・了々斎（宝珠）、裏千家・認得斎（小槌）の2作の賛を得て、表装を行う。

sen.j: 史料編纂に興味を持ち、天明の大火で失った家伝の再編纂を決意、「奥村家系図」、「千家御好表具并諸色寸法控」乾巻・坤巻を著し、茶道具の様式や、茶会のルールなど、貴重な資料を後世に伝える功績を残す。
sen.e: He was interested in compiling historical materials, and decided to compile again the family tradition lost in the Great Fire of Tenmei, writing 'A Family Tree of the Okumura Family' and two volumes of 'A Record of Colors and Sizes of Mounting Preferred by the House of Sen,' producing brilliant achievement in the important historical materials such as styles of tea utensils and rules of tea party for the posterity.
